runs.comm: swinging into the pads, worked away square for one
tucked off the hips for another single
big inswinger, good bounce too, hits him in the thigh pad. Or did it miss it? Watson grimaced
another big inswinger, extra bounce again, another hit in the thigh area
pulled away this time to long leg, gets a single
goes for the pull, beaten outside off, the angle does him there
outswinger, steered down to third man, but Watson is not awake to the fumble from Mathews. In fact he strolled the first, and was in no position to capitalise
cut away in front of square, can't beat point
this is a proper wide, a Test match wide, way way outside off
tucked away off the hips for a single
lovely outswinger, hits him plumb in front, but for the late inside edge
another lovely outswinger, not much room either, pushed away for one
full toss on the pads, the first rank loose delivery, and is smashed to midwicket
Typical Watson shot, length ball, inswinger, just a flick over mid-on, and it has travelled all the way for a six
big big inswinger, well down the leg side, Sanga dives full length to keep the damage down to just one wide

Bowled him! This inswinger is perfect. Short of driving length, and starts well outside off so it can hit top of off. Watson tries to smash it through the off side, leaves the bat-pad gap open, and is bowled. ah, there is an inside edge too, which drags the ball to top of middle
and starts off nicely, with a clip to square leg off the pads
pulled away, over the top of square leg, beats long leg
Warner has stunned the crowd into silence with back-to-back fours. Cut away in front of square this time. Kula hasn't quite bowled well to the left-hand batsmen
and just then he beats Warner with one that stays low. Pitched middle and leg, moving away, beats Warner's attempt at a short-arm pull

what is happening here? First of all this takes off from nowhere, and Marsh is still stunned even as Warner has almost reached his end trying to steal a bye. Warner has to hare back, and makes it, thanks to a wide throw from Sanga
canny little offcutter here, beats Marsh, stares at him, Sanga applauds him from behind. Not a word spoken
cut away now, to third man for one
Warner is playing on a different pitch. Sees the slower ball early, clears the front leg, and goes right over the bowler's head
hits him in the pad with a yorker, but it is swinging down the leg side, hence no lbw
good late swing into his pads, clipped away to square leg
pushed down the leg side.. no turn first ball
slower, tossed higher, driven to long-on for one
turn there, seemed like angling down the leg side, before turning away and taking the leading edge through the vacant spin

Gets a wicket in his first over! This one turned away too, beats an attempt to play it to on, hits him in front. Interesting to see where it pitched. Pitches middle leg, hits him in front of leg after straightening. Would have gone on to hit the leg stumps, I think
Perera is charged up, tosses this up, and then dives to his right to field it too
driven square on the off side for a single
big turn this time, pitches middle and leg, and leaves him, pushed to short third
starts with a gentle short ball, and is puled wide of mid-on. Poor start by Prasad, Hussey capitalises
No appeal. This is an outswinger, takes the edge, there is a noise, Sanga goes up late, almost an afterthought, de Silva doesn't give it. That was gone. Hussey also looked back right away
desperate stuff, giving him the charge, is beaten by a quick back-of-a-length delivery
driven away from the body, to third man for one
this has taken off from just short of a length, Warner is clearly late into the pull, but gets a faint top edge past the diving Sanga
Timber... this is top bowling... From round the stumps, angled away, pitching outside off, and back through the gate to hit the top of middle
stays round the stumps, offbreak from outside off, gets an inside edge for a single
length ball on the pads, pushed to long-on for one
arm ball, pitches leg, goes towards off, pushed back to the bowler
worked off the pads for one
tossed up, doesn't turn as much as expected, gets an inside edge for a single
it stops at him a touch and Warner checks the drive, but it is timed well enough to go between the bowler and mid-off for four
driven down the ground and along the ground, but mid-off is back now
long hop, and pulled away dismissively, past midwicket for four, despite the instinctive initial forward movement
what a delivery to come back, cuts him into two, this one jags back big time, and bisects the bat and pad. Huge appeal from Sanga, but a good call by Asoka
nearly got him, this one is fuller, nips back in again, gets the inside edge onto the pad
yorker, at the base of off, Warner digs it out. Good comeback after that poor short ball

Perera is running through them here. White goes for a huge slog sweep. This is an offbreak from round the stumps, slow through the air, pitches outside off, turns in, beats the shot, and hits the off stump. Perera is blase about it
angled across him, pushed to short third for one
turn and bounce, pitches leg, hits him in the thigh area as he looks to turn this to leg
driven with the turn, gets a single to sweeper-cover
extra bounce saves Smith as he is beaten trying to turn this to leg
flat on the pad, worked away for an easy single
full on off, beats a premeditated sweep
chipped towards midwicket, just short
slower through the air, beats another attempt at a sweep, he is rushing through the over
charges at him, gets a leading edge towards long-off
beautiful offspin bowling, teasing him with the loop, asking him to drive, and then getting the turn to get the edge. No slip for Dilshan, though
comes down the track to get a single to long-on
if I were really harsh, I would call this a drop. A big bottom edge into the Sanga's shin
pushed to cover for one
short ball, pulled from wide outside off, gets a single to long-on
sharp turn there, cut away to sweeper-cover for one
short-arm jab to long-on for a single
sees him coming down the track, and bowls teasingly slow, gets turn too, Smith drops it to cover
another really slow offbreak, cut away to sweeper-cover
beaten in the flight, ends up chipping this just over midwicket
sharp offbreak, but nicely dabbed down to third man, from outside the line of leg
rare poor ball, and Warner gets under this long hop to deposit this into the crowd behind the square-leg fence
this is fuller, doesn't turn much, gets the inside edge for a single
big swipe across the line, makes contact with thin air
Herath's carom ball, Warner is bamboozled, pitches leg, turns to off, gets the leading edge as he is looking to slog-sweep. Falls short of short third

the left-armer's legbreak has done him in. Smith has been jumping out of the crease with no clue as to what to do next, and this team the ball makes its way through the gap between bat and pad. Stumped
the orthodox slow left-arm here, leaving Haddin, beating the defensive prod. Sanga whips the bails off, the replays show his foot comes back just in time
full outside off, driven to long-off for one
Dilshan has dropped Warner at midwicket. This was a fairly easy chance, he had it covered, at a comfortable chest height, but the ball popped out. Dilshan is disgusted with himself
pulled away for a single
sharp offbreak, worked around the corner for one
Warner drives this down to long-off for one
slow offbreak outside off, pushed to midwicket
another accurate offbreak, played back to Dilshan
the quicker, straighter one, Haddin reads it well, guides it between the keeper and third man
Warner gets to fifty with a pull off this rank long hop. Wide of midwicket. Mild acknowledgement for the applause from the balcony
cut away, but straight to backward point
driven to long-off for one

it's not raining, it's pouring on the Aussies... this was full on the pads, was flicked to deep midwicket, Haddin wanted to, Warner initially did, but then didn't. Too late to send him back. Sold Haddin down the river
carrom ball, turning from leg to off, Johnson sends back Warner now
starts off with a wide yorker, a touch too wide
full and wide, beats him with the away swing, but called a wide

Gone. Kulasekara has been bowling them wide, two of them have been called wide, Warner stretches and finally gets bat to it... and finds extra cover, and it's the same man who dropped him earlier - Dilshan
big inswinger, hits the thigh pad for a leg-bye
driven down the ground, on the up, gets a single to long-off
absolute corker, jags back in from back of a length, cuts him into half
low full toss, hit to long-on for one
Johnson has a swipe at this inswinger outside off. Beaten
short, across him, cut away to cover-point
short again, but finds midwicket with the pull
floater outside off, beats the outside edge
O'Keefe slogs this one for six, clears the front leg, and swings merrily. It's a length ball on the pads, which helps
O'Keefe is getting stuck into Perera, sweeps him over square, finds the gap between deep back wards square and deep midwicket
and now the reverse-sweep, goes swiftly past point for  four more. Just delaying the inevitable I am afraid
Dropped. An absolute sitter for Mathews at long-off. He goes with the fingers pointing skywards, the ball bursts through them and hits him in the chest
full and wide inswinger, just inside those guide lines for wides
good-looking drive on the up, wide of long-on, gets a couple
Lovely clean swing, almost golf-like, over long-on. Admires the shot, and it is worth admiring
low full toss this time, shipped to midwicket for one
that's the drag flick! Walks across the stumps, and flicks this from outside off, over the keeper's head
that's one of the fours. A loosener first up, and he smashes this full toss wide of midwicket
slower short ball, beats Johnson's swing across the line
low full toss, gets an inside edge onto the pad, gets a single
full ball, slogged down to long-on. Lakmal doesn't realise they are coming for two, and doesn't go to disturb the bails. He was gone otherwise
Timber. Full, in front of off, O'Keefe swings, misses, hears the death rattle
low full toss, pushed to long-off for a single
Hastings lofts over the bowler's head, gets a couple
slogged away this time to midwicket, and Lakmal's overthrow goes for four overthrows, through Lakmal's leg. Bad bounce involved
pushed into the on side for a couple
low full toss, placed for a couple into the on side
driven down to long-on for one
Australia finish off in style... but lose by 35 runs! Hastings clears the front leg, gets down on the knee, and slogs this for the biggest six of the night
